sentences: Kuue, jaki, pluusi, kleidi, mantli, palitu käis on katki.
context: The word 'käis' in Estonian refers to the sleeve part of a clothing item that covers the arm. It's used when talking about sleeves on various garments like coats, jackets, blouses, dresses, etc. The word can be found in different combinations with other clothing items and is often discussed in terms of length (long/short sleeves) or condition (torn/broken sleeve).
